official_title: Effectiveness of a Cloud-based Digital Health Navigation Program for Colorectal Cancer Screening
inclusion_criteria:
1. Age 45 - 74 years old
2. Have no record of current colorectal cancer screening per United States Preventive Service Task Force guidelines. Current screening is defined as:

   1. Completed a colonoscopy within the last 10 years
   2. Completed a FIT-DNA (example: Cologuard) test within the past 3 years
   3. Completed a FIT in the last 1 year
3. Have a cell phone number listed in the EHR
4. Have a preferred language of English or Spanish in the EHR
5. Have a upcoming primary care appointment within 9 to 16 days
Healthy volunteers allowed
Must have minimum age of 45 Years
Must have maximum age of 74 Years
exclusion_criteria:
1. Prior diagnosis of colorectal cancer.
2. Prior diagnosis of inflammatory bowel disease
3. Diagnosis of condition that would make patient inappropriate for CRC screening

   1. Moderate to severe liver disease (ICD-10)
   2. Metastatic solid tumor (ICD-10)
   3. AIDS (ICD-10)
